comments:
On Suse 7.3 with Eclipse SDK GTK2 M5 build, and with 20020509 nightly build.

In the first run of Eclipse help does not work (help action does not launch 
Mozilla, F1 does not work, help preference page does not display), and messages 
in the console say that org.eclipse.help.ui plugin is deactivated.

On the subsequent runs of Eclipse, problem does not occur.

Please attach the log file with the messages.
Thanks.

The .log:

!SESSION ----------------------------------------------------------------------

1 !ENTRY org.eclipse.core.runtime 2 2 !ENTRY org.eclipse.core.runtime 2 2

eclipse@help2:~/eclipse>

Which build are you running....motif or gtk?
The OS selection in the bug report and the .log indicate motif but your initial
report says GTK.

I am able to startup ok and run help on both the motif and gtk 0509 nightly
builds on RH7.2. Will try and reproduce the problem on Suse.
I ran GTK build on Suse.  Changing OS field to Linux-GTK.

The .log that you included was from a Linux-Motif run. Was the log from the 
GTK run the same? Thanks.

I see 2 problems here:

1). There was an NPE in calling (new Date().toString()) in the 
PlatformConfiguration.write method.

2). There was an NPE when writing to the platform log and console. Maybe in 
the same (new Date().toString()) call as above?

What happens on your machine when you do a new Date().toString() in a 
scrapbook page? Does it work?

I have modified the log writer to print stack traces rather than just 
class/messages of problems when writing to log file (in case console writing 
fails too)

There was a bit of mess on our test machine:  The driver installed was the
20020509 motif (not GTK) nightly.
With this driver the Scrappbook does not work, there were errors in the workbench.
Date().toString() worked O.K. when I tried running a Test program from the
command line.
Upgraded jdk to IBM1.3.1, this had no effect on how Eclipse run.

I have tried the same with the 20020510 motif integration build.  Works like a
charm.

So the bug is not really valid anymore if510 driver has later code than 509
nightly.  Feel free to close the bug.  Thanks.

I cannot try gtk build 20020510, it complains that cannot find swt library, but
it is a different problem I suppose.

Closing bug at originator's request.

Fixed log file so it better reports errors writing to console/log.
Also fixed it so not being able to print out the Date doesn't kill it.
Core ready to be reviewed and released.
